results.title: Swimmy
results.creator_credit: Giulio Gianini, Leo Lionni and Connecticut Films
results.brief_description: This prize-winning animated film is Leo Lionni’s own interpretation of his original fable about the small fish, Swimmy, which outwits the hungry tuna and leads the other fish in exploring the marvellous underwater world.

results.title: Swimming in the backyard
results.creator_credit: Polly Watkins, Beth Frey and Blackout Productions
results.brief_description: This short documentary was commissioned by SBS Independent as part of its ‘Australia by Numbers’ series about community life in various postcodes around Australia. This episode centres on the municipal pool in Prahran, an inner suburb of Melbourne. Every summer, since it was built in the 1960’s, the pool has been a magnet for a diverse range of locals who go there both to socialise and exercise. A constant over the years has been the pool’s two long serving managers, who know and are known by almost everyone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Polly Watkins, Beth Frey and Blackout Productions

results.title: Sweet smell of success [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, James Hill and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film noir has been well described as, ‘a rat trap of a film’, a compelling portrayal of corruption in which an unscrupulous small-time press agent, intent on clawing his way to the top, debases himself for the favours of a monster of a newspaper columnist. While it does not involve murder, the degree of manipulation and self deception is truly noir. Sidney Falco, the agent, is ultimately a more sympathetic figure because the cold bloodedness and self-righteous egomania of the columnist, J.J. Hunsecker, sets Falco’s faint glimmerings of self-disgust into relief. Susan Hunsecker, the object of her brother’s repressed incestuous desire, is the one figure who provides some moral bearings and delivers the retribution that J.J. fears. New York locations, aided by James Wong Howe’s night photography and Bernstein’s limpid jazz score, have never seemed bleaker. Featuring Burt Lancaster, Tony Curtis, Susan Harrison, Screenplay, Clifford Odets and Ernest Lehman from the novelette by Ernest Lehman.

results.title: Sweet love, bitter
results.creator_credit: Herbert Danska, Lewis Jacobs, Louis W Kellman and Film Three Productions
results.brief_description: Fictional chronicle depicting the last years of jazz musician’s Charlie ‘Bird’ Parker’s life. Capturing the trials and tribulations of a black musician in white America, this film takes an in-depth look at the multi-faceted world of the jazz life — music, drink, drugs, racism, women, and indifference. Features Dick Gregory in the key role as Richie ‘Eagle’ Stokes, with Don Murray playing a down-and-out professor. Adapted from the John A. Williams’ novel “Night song”.

results.title: Sweet dreams [the story of Patsy Cline]
results.creator_credit: Karel Reisz, Bernard Schwartz and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: Jessica Lange stars as country-western singer Patsy Cline, whose tragic death in 1963 cut short one of the most fabulous success stories in the annals of popular music. In contrast with Cline’s rise to fame in the years between 1956 and 1963, her private life was turbulent and tragic. As the wife of hard-drinking Charlie Dick (Ed Harris), Patsy is subjected to all manner of abuse and humiliation, yet she stays on. A happy second marriage is all too short-lived, as is Patsy herself. Patsy Cline’s fans may notice that Robert Gretchell’s screenplay takes quite a few liberties with details of Patsy’s life.

results.title: Swan Lake
results.creator_credit: Askhat Murtazin, Felix Slidovker, Inessa Seleznova and Ekran Creative Union Gosteleradio
results.brief_description: Presents a magnificent performance of the ballet “Swan Lake” by the Bolshoi Ballet with music by Tchaikovsky. Features Natalia Bessmertnova, Alexander Bogatirov and Boris Akimov.

results.title: Suzi's story
results.creator_credit: Iain E. Gillespie, Carlyon-Gillespie Production and Pro-image
results.brief_description: This is the true story of the Lovegrove family. It is the story of Suzi, a loving wife and mother stricken with AIDS. This documentary poignantly deals with this tragic and deadly virus, and seeks to educate the viewer about the debilitating effects of AIDS not only on the victim, but on those who love her. This film sensitively brings home the reality of AIDS. It won’t easily be forgotten.

results.title: Svadebka
results.creator_credit: Hans Hulsher, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and RM Arts
results.brief_description: A studio recording of the renowned Netherlands Dance Theatre’s interpretation of Stravinsky’s Les Noces (Svadebka). Choreographed by Jiri Kylian, the piece pictures the ceremony of a traditonal Russian country wedding through a fusion of ballet with some contemporary influences. The dance engages with the rapid pace and intricate rhythms of Stravinsky’s score in a spirited evocation of the mystery of marriage, both its beauty and apprehension, particularly for the bride to be.

results.title: Survivors of the Holocaust
results.creator_credit: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions
results.brief_description: Chronicles the events of the Shoah (Holocaust) as witnessed by those who survived. This documentary combines archival footage with the survivor’s personal testamonies and photographs, describing life in pre-war Europe, the devastating impact of Nazism, the liberation of the concentration camps and life fifty years later. The impact of the survivor’s stories prompted Steven Spielberg to establish Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation, a non-profit project to videotape tens of thousands of these personal accounts and make them available for education worldwide.
